conclusion: Liquid flows out from A, B, C, and D, and passes through baffles to reach containers E, F, or G.
A (yellow liquid) starts from the top left.
B (green liquid) starts next to A.
C (cyan liquid) starts next to B.
D (blue liquid) starts next to C.
Orange baffle is slanted to direct liquid to the left.
Grey baffle is slanted to direct liquid to the right.
Blue baffle is slanted to direct liquid to the right.
Red baffle is slanted to direct liquid to the left.

premise: A (yellow liquid) flows down and is directed by the orange baffle.
B (green liquid) flows down, guided by the grey baffle, and merges with A.
conclusion: Most of B flows into container E.

premise: Some of B flows along the grey baffle and does not merge with A.
conclusion: Some of B flows into container F.

premise: C (cyan liquid) flows down, guided by the grey baffle, and hits the red slanted barrier.
conclusion: C deflects to the left and flows into container F.

premise: D (blue liquid) flows down and is directed by the blue baffle.
A flows into container E; most of B flows into container E; some of B flows into container F; C flows into container F; D flows into container G.
conclusion: Container E receives yellow and most of green liquid; container F receives cyan and some green liquid; container G receives blue liquid.
